lesson_title: Document Types and the KEW APIs
lesson_objectives:
• Define various configurations of KEW Document Types that include routing definitions
  • Use the KEW APIs to test these Document Type definitions.
  • Learn how the KEW APIs can be used to determine what kinds of valid actions are available on a workflow document.

lesson_title: Adding Workflow to the Bookstore Application
lesson_objectives:
• Modify the Book Order document so that it generates XML that can be used for routing purposes.
  • Create Rule Attributes using XPath expressions to implement logic which will evaluate that XML.
  • Define Routing Rules based on your Rule Attributes which will define the Action Requests to generate for the Book Order document.

• Create a new role called “Warehouse Manager”.
  • Configure qualifiers on the role which are based on “Book Category”.
  • Replace the rule-based routing you did in the previous exercise for warehouse processing with responsibility-based routing on this new role.
